      Return the interior point where the lines between two circles' tangents intersect, if they have different radii (from Wolfram Mathworld) A line tangent to both circles will pass through this point

      Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component (projected by time from line o) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.

      Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component as average of the closest end point of each line) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.

      • LoS

        public static boolean LoS​(Vect3 so,
                          Vect3 si,
                          double D,
                          double H)
        Returns true if aircraft are in loss of separation at time 0.
        Parameters:
        so - the relative position of the ownship aircraft
        si - the relative position of the traffic aircraft
        D - the minimum horizontal distance
        H - the minimum vertical distance
        Returns:
        true, if aircraft are in loss of separation

        Parameters:

        b - point B
        p - point P
        Returns:

        public static Vect3 interpolate​(Vect3 v1,
                                Vect3 v2,
                                double f)
        Interpolate between two vectors.
        Parameters:
        v1 - first position
        v2 - second position
        f - a fraction. Should be between 0 and 1 to interpolate. If 0, then v1 is returned, if 1 then v2 is returned.
        Returns:
        interpolated vector

                      double D,
                      int eps)
        Q function (relative tangent point)
        Parameters:
        s - point outside circle with origin center
        D - radius of circle
        eps - direction (+/-1)
        Returns:
        point on origin-centered circle that is tangent and passes through s, or INVALID if s is within the circle

      • intersection

        public static Pair<Vect3,​java.lang.Double> intersection​(Vect3 so3,
                                                              Velocity vo3,
                                                              Vect3 si3,
                                                              Velocity vi3)
        Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component (projected by time from line o) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.
        Parameters:
        so3 - starting point of line o
        vo3 - direction vector for line o
        si3 - starting point of line i
        vi3 - direction vector of line i
        Returns:
        Pair (2-dimensional point of intersection, relative time of intersection, relative to the so3) Note the intersection may be in the past (i.e. negative time) If the lines are 2-D parallel (including collinear) this returns the pair (0,NaN).

      • intersection2D

        public static Pair<Vect2,​java.lang.Double> intersection2D​(Vect2 so,
                                                                Vect2 vo,
                                                                Vect2 si,
                                                                Vect2 vi)
        Intersection of 2 (2D) lines
        Parameters:
        so - current position on line 1
        vo - velocity of so along line 1
        si - current position on line 2
        vi - velocity of si on line 2
        Returns:
        position and time along line 1, or (0,NaN) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

      • intersectSegment

        public static double intersectSegment​(Vect2 si,
                                      Vect2 vi,
                                      Vect2 a,
                                      Vect2 b)
        NOT FULLY DEBUGGED !! Return the distance at which si, traveling in direction vi, will intersect with segment ab (inclusive)
        Parameters:
        si - position of vehicle
        vi - velocity of vehicle
        a - an end point of segment
        b - an end point of segment
        Returns:
        distance of intersection, or negative if no intersection

      • timeOfIntersection

        public static double timeOfIntersection​(Vect3 so3,
                                        Velocity vo3,
                                        Vect3 si3,
                                        Velocity vi3)
        Computes 2D intersection point of two infinite lines
        Parameters:
        so3 - starting point of line 1
        vo3 - direction vector for line 1
        si3 - starting point of line 2
        vi3 - direction vector of line 2
        Returns:
        time the OWNSHIP (so3) will reach the point. Note that the intruder (si3) may have already passed this point. If the lines are parallel, this returns NaN.

      • intersectionAvgZ

        public static Pair<Vect3,​java.lang.Double> intersectionAvgZ​(Vect3 so1,
                                                                  Vect3 so2,
                                                                  double dto,
                                                                  Vect3 si1,
                                                                  Vect3 si2)
        Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component as average of the closest end point of each line) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.
        Parameters:
        so1 - starting point of line o
        so2 - ending point of line o
        dto - delta time
        si1 - starting point of line i
        si2 - ending point of line i
        Returns:
        Pair (2-dimensional point of intersection, relative time of intersection, relative to the so1) This includes the average altitude between the *endpoints* closest to the point of intersection Note the intersection may be in the past (i.e. negative time) If the lines are parallel, this returns the pair (0,NaN).

      • intersection2D

        public static Pair<Vect2,​java.lang.Double> intersection2D​(Vect2 so1,
                                                                Vect2 so2,
                                                                double dto,
                                                                Vect2 si1,
                                                                Vect2 si2)
        2D intersection of two infinite lines
        Parameters:
        so1 - first point of line o
        so2 - second point of line o
        dto - the delta time between point so and point so2.
        si1 - first point of line i
        si2 - second point of line i
        Returns:
        a pair: intersection point and the delta time from point "so" to the intersection, can be negative if intersect point is in the past. Returns (0,NaN) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

      • intersectSegments

        public static Pair<Vect2,​java.lang.Double> intersectSegments​(Vect2 so,
                                                                   Vect2 so2,
                                                                   Vect2 si,
                                                                   Vect2 si2)
        2D intersection of two segments (finite length) at a single point This treats overlapping segments as no intersection
        Parameters:
        so - first point of line o
        so2 - second point of line o
        si - first point of line i
        si2 - second point of line i
        Returns:
        a pair: intersection point and the fraction of the distance from point "so" to the intersection. Returns (INVALID,fractDist) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

      • distPerp

        public static Pair<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> distPerp​(Vect2 s,
                                                                     Vect2 v,
                                                                     Vect2 q)
        returns the perpendicular time and distance between line defined by s,v and point q.
        Parameters:
        s - point on line
        v - velocity vector of line
        q - a point not on the line
        Returns:
        time to perpendicular location on line (relative to s) and perpendicular distance

      • behind

        public static boolean behind​(Vect2 x,
                             Vect2 so,
                             Vect2 vo)
        Returns true if x is "behind" so , that is, x is within the region behind the perpendicular line to vo through so.
        Parameters:
        x - a position
        so - aircraft position
        vo - aircraft velocity
        Returns:
        true, if x is behind so

      • passingDirection

        public static int passingDirection​(Vect3 so,
                                   Velocity vo,
                                   Vect3 si,
                                   Velocity vi)
        Returns values indicating whether the ownship state will pass in front of or behind the intruder (from a horizontal perspective)
        Parameters:
        so - ownship position
        vo - ownship velocity
        si - intruder position
        vi - intruder velocity
        Returns:
        1 if ownship will pass in front (or collide, from a horizontal sense), -1 if ownship will pass behind, 0 if divergent or parallel

      • planeNormal

        public static Vect3 planeNormal​(Vect3 a,
                                Vect3 b,
                                Vect3 c)
        Calculate the normal (perpendicular vector) of a plane defined by 3 points. This is not necessarily a unit vector.
        Parameters:
        a - point 1
        b - point 2
        c - point 3
        Returns:
        the normal vector

      • onSide

        public static int onSide​(Vect2 s,
                         Vect2 v,
                         Vect2 p)
        Return the side (+1 right, -1 left) of the ray s(point),v(velocity) that point p is on. If value is zero, p is on the line (given no floating point issues)
        Parameters:
        s - position vector
        v - velocity vector
        p - another position vector
        Returns:
        (+1 right, -1 left)

      • internalCenterOfSimilitude

        public static Vect2 internalCenterOfSimilitude​(Vect2 c1,
                                               double r1,
                                               Vect2 c2,
                                               double r2)
        Return the interior point where the lines between two circles' tangents intersect (from Wolfram Mathworld). A line tangent to both circles will pass through this point
        Parameters:
        c1 - center of circle 1
        r1 - radius of circle 1
        c2 - center of circle 2
        r2 - radius of circle 2
        Returns:
        interior center of similitude. This version will test if the circles overlap and return INVALID in that case.

      • externalCenterOfSimilitude

        public static Vect2 externalCenterOfSimilitude​(Vect2 c1,
                                               double r1,
                                               Vect2 c2,
                                               double r2)
        Return the interior point where the lines between two circles' tangents intersect, if they have different radii (from Wolfram Mathworld) A line tangent to both circles will pass through this point
        Parameters:
        c1 - center of circle 1
        r1 - radius of circle 1
        c2 - center of circle 2
        r2 - radius of circle 2
        Returns:
        exterior center of similitude. This version will test if the circles overlap and return INVALID in that case. It will also return INVALID if they have the same radii.

      • tangentSegments

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Pair<Vect2,​Vect2>> tangentSegments​(Vect2 c1,
                                                                           double r1,
                                                                           Vect2 c2,
                                                                           double r2)
        Return a list of segments that are tangent to two circles
        Parameters:
        c1 - center of circle 1
        r1 - radius of circle 1
        c2 - center of circle 2
        r2 - radius of circle 2
        Returns:
        endpoints of segments (from c1 to c2) tangent to both circles. This list will be empty if the circles overlap.

      • parse

        public static Vect3 parse​(java.lang.String str)
        This parses a space or comma-separated string as a Vect3 (an inverse to the toString method). If three bare values are present, then it is interpreted as the default units for a Vect3: [NM,NM,ft]. If there are 3 value/unit pairs then each values is interpreted with regard to the appropriate unit. If the string cannot be parsed, an INVALID Vect3 is returned.
        Parameters:
        str - string to parse
        Returns:
        point
